title: No early election despite Rayner resignation and Farage claims, says prime minister’s key adviser – UK politics live
summary: Chief Secretary Darren Jones stated that the resignation of Rayner prompted an earlier-than-expected reshuffle within the Labour party. He emphasized that there is no division within the party despite the leadership changes. The move is seen as a strategic response to recent developments.

title: World Cup qualifying buildup to England v Andorra, WSL Q&A  and Football League – matchday live
summary: Football updates include the latest news ahead of Saturday's World Cup qualifying matches and Women's Super League (WSL) action. Teams are finalizing their rosters and strategies as they prepare for crucial games. Fans are eager for the outcomes of these significant fixtures.

title: How I became a Buffalo Bills fan – and learned what home means
summary: The author, who previously had little interest in sports, became inspired by the Buffalo Bills’ underdog spirit. They highlight how the team's struggles create a sense of unity among the city's residents. This newfound connection underscores the emotional power of sports in bringing people together.

title: Slow Horses author Mick Herron: ‘I love doing things that are against the rules’
summary: The creator of the hit thriller discusses the challenges and unexpected inspirations behind its return. He reveals his unique storytelling approach, emphasizing that he avoids delving into the thoughts of the main character, Jackson Lamb. The interview highlights the show's creative journey and evolution.

title: Move over fashion week: Chanel and Dior soft launch creations at Venice film festival
summary: Major brands are showcasing their latest collections on red carpets and gondolas in a historic Italian city. The event highlights the work of newly installed designers, emphasizing a blend of fashion and culture. This innovative approach aims to attract attention and elevate the city's status in the fashion world.
